Let $G$ be a graph with chromatic number $\aleph_1$. Must there exist an edge $e$ such that, for all large $n$, $G$ contains a cycle of length $n$ containing $e$?



A problem of Erd\H{o}s, Hajnal, and Shelah \cite{EHS74}, who proved that $G$ must contain all sufficiently large cycles (see [594]).

This is true, and was proved by Thomassen \cite{Th83}.





References


[EHS74] Erd\H{o}s, P. and Hajnal, A. and Shelah, S., On some general properties of chromatic numbers. Topics in topology (Proc. Colloq., Keszthely, 1972) (1974), 243-255.

[Th83] Thomassen, Carsten, Cycles in graphs of uncountable chromatic number. Combinatorica (1983), 133--134.
